heroDescription: Edmonds, Washington, is a vibrant coastal city known for its scenic waterfront and strong community.
landscapeDescription: Edmonds boasts a diverse economy with a focus on healthcare, retail, and technology. The city is well-positioned within the Seattle metropolitan area, benefiting from its proximity to major urban centers.
uniqueNeeds: Edmonds requires tailored financial strategies to address its unique coastal risks and economic landscape.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Edmonds' tech sector growth necessitates diversification to mitigate market volatility. Real estate prices are rising, posing bubble risks. Prepare for flooding and economic shifts.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Edmonds has experienced steady economic growth, driven by local businesses and an influx of tech firms.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median income in Edmonds is approximately $82,000, reflecting a relatively affluent community.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Edmonds are increasingly specializing in retirement planning and real estate investment.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), the cost of living in Edmonds is higher than the national average, driven by housing and healthcare expenses.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), the real estate market in Edmonds is competitive, with home prices rising due to limited inventory and high demand.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Edmonds offers a supportive business environment with resources for startups and established companies alike.
